item.title: Getting started with parsing
item.description: A simple parser # The simplest way to write a parser is to use the recursive descent technique. This creates a top-down parser (which may formally be described a LL(1)). To start the example we first have to establish the grammar rules for our language. In this example we will use simple arithmetic expression assignments for expressions that can only use the plus operator: Assignment --> Identifier := Expression Expression --> Expression + Term | Term Term --> Identifier | (Expression) Identifier --> x | y | z For each rule of the grammar we can write a procedure to recognise the incoming tokens to the rule.
